title: Retro font with triangles
content:
Can't find this font and hope it isn't an artist rendition...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Taxi-Terrys-Logo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701144610/http:/typophile.com/files/Taxi-Terrys-Logo.png) | 43.31 KB |
author: Pat54

comments.content:
Similar to Binner Poster [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/binner-poster/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701144610/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/binner-poster/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/binner-poster/") but there are differences.  
Don

I thing it's **[Oldgate Lane Outline](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701144610/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-2&ffam=OldgateLaneOutline%20-%20Regular&fid=85f79041ef45068997d3d51ee6dd42d3&fsize=60&text=Taxi%20Terry's&fit=1)** free font by Nick Curtis [2000]

I agree Fivos with your suggestion. I have not been able to find a note as to the source Nick Curtis used as an inspiration for Oldgate Lane Outline, but it's obviously Binner Poster, condensed in width, edited as to some details and given an outline treatment. Compare:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701144610im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BinnerOldgateLaneOutline_5419.jpg)
  
Don
